content:
Yes, some host bird species are better at detecting and rejecting cuckoo eggs than others. For example, some studies have found that the European magpie is particularly adept at recognizing and removing cuckoo eggs from their nests. Other host bird species that are known to be good at recognizing cuckoo eggs include the reed warbler, the dunnock, and the meadow pipit.

However, it's worth noting that different host bird species may have developed different strategies to cope with brood parasitism, and some may be more effective than others depending on the specific environment and ecological conditions. For example, some host bird species may be better at rejecting cuckoo eggs, while others may be better at tolerating cuckoo chicks and adjusting their parental behavior to reduce the negative effects on their own offspring.
